## Exercise 1B

1. Prove that $−(−v) = v$ for every $v\in V$.
**Solution**:
Let $v\in V$. Then there exist a unique additive inverse of $v$. We denote it by $-v$. Thus,
\[v+(-v)=0.\] Then by definition, additive inverse of $(-v)$ is v. We denote it by $-(-v)=v$.
